text: Consider the following relational schemas: o AutoWorkshop (Workshop Name, Address, Director) « Auto(Auto_License, Owner) « Repair(Receipt_No, Workshop_Name, Auto_License, Type, Date, Cost) Assume that Repair (Workshop_Name) references AutoWorkshop (Workshop_Name) and Repair (Auto_License) references Auto (Auto_License). Also Assume that there is no Auto_license MP-09- MA-2023 in the Auto relation. Which of the following statements can cause a violation of an integrity constraint specified in the relational schema? (a) INSERT INTO Auto (AutoiLicense, Owner) VALUES (‘MP-09-MA-2023', NULL) (b] UPDATE Auto SET Auto. AutoiLicense = 'MP-09-CS-2022" (c) DROP TABLE AutoWorkshop (d) INSERT INTO Repair (Workshop Name, Receipt No) VALUES (‘Sojatia Auto’, ‘'1007)
